item.title: Help with commands using substring
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Try this:
(Can’t guarantee it, just writing it in here)

String name = command.substring(8); for (int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.maxPlayers; i++) { if(server.playerhandler.players[i] != null) { if (server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) { //do what you want here like: server.playerHandler.players[i].aMethod(); } } }

item.title: Help with commands using substring
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

You have two things with the same name. The string, and the Player object. Also, you never use the string, so what is the point of it?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with commands using substring
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

String Player = command.substring(8); for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { if(p != null){ client noob = (client)p; noob.Addpts(); } } }
Um, from what I see, the string after the 8th ‘character’ typed in the command is Player, in which the for loop gets the id for Player p (p being the ID for the player) then it determines that p is not null. Is that not correct? I see no error in the logic… explain?

Read full topic

Look at the String variable, and then in the for loop.

item.title: Help with commands using substring
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

I’m having problems with using command.substring (), such as the syntax of ::givemod. Using the below method of defining a player name to [code]give points to:

String Player = command.substring(8);
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
if(p != null){
client noob = (client)p;
noob.Addpts();
}
}
}[/code]

Defines every person online as client noob, thus adding points to each player.
The next method, works about 20% of the time. The other eighty, it runs the catch exception, even though the player i online…

String name = command.substring(8); try { int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p]; c.Addpts(); }catch (Exception e) { sendMessage(+c" is either not online or doesn't exist."); } }

Any help?

Read full topic
